meta_title: Divorce in Atlanta - TDE Family Law
meta_description: Navigating divorce in Atlanta made easier with accurate legal assistance. Contact TDE Family Law & Divorce Attorneys for outstanding client services throughout the process.
first_100_words: Divorce in Atlanta Divorce is a difficult decision to make, but there are many reasons to file for one. If you are considering divorce or you’re ready to file, call our team to provide you with accurate legal assistance. We assure you of outstanding client services throughout the process. TDE Family Law & Divorce Attorneys, a family law firm in Atlanta, GA, has seen firsthand the varied challenges and considerations faced by those navigating divorce. This article explores how divorce affects individuals at different life stages, highlighting the unique experiences and hurdles encountered during young adulthood, midlife, and later life.

meta_description: Protect your parental rights with the help of our experienced child custody lawyer in Atlanta. We understand the system and will fight for the best interests of your child.
first_100_words: Child Custody Lawyer in Atlanta Custody decisions in Georgia are based on the best interests of the child. You know what is in your child’s best interests better than anyone, but it is important for the court to understand your viewpoint in order to get the right outcome for your family. That’s where a dedicated child custody lawyer in Atlanta comes in to play. At TDE Family Law & Divorce Attorneys, we understand how to support your position and will fight aggressively to protect your rights and help you reach your goals for child custody. meta_title: Alimony/Spousal Support Lawyer - TDE Family Law
meta_description: Navigating alimony issues in a divorce? Our experienced lawyers can guide you through the process and help protect your financial interests.
h1: Alimony & Spousal Support Lawyer in Atlanta
first_100_words: Alimony & Spousal Support Lawyer in Atlanta Alimony, also known as spousal support, is often one of the most contentious issues in a divorce. Courts can order one spouse to make payments to the other temporarily while the divorce proceedings are in progress, or they may require payments to continue on long after the divorce is finalized. Whether you are the one seeking alimony or you want to limit your liability for alimony payments, it is crucial to understand your rights and the factors that go into alimony decisions. meta_title: Property Division Enforcement - TDE Family Law
meta_description: Navigate the complexities of property division enforcement in divorce. Get valuable insights from our family law attorneys on ensuring a fair division of marital property.
first_100_words: Property Division Enforcement What is Property Division Enforcement? When couples decide to part ways through divorce, one of the most complex and emotionally charged issues is the division of property. In Georgia, like in many other states, the division of marital property is subject to legal scrutiny to ensure fairness. However, even after a divorce is finalized and a property division order is issued, disputes can still arise. The attorneys at TDE Family Law & Divorce Attorneys, specialize in enforcing property division. This page explores the intricacies of property division enforcement, offering valuable insights for those navigating this challenging aspect

meta_title: Paternity Testing - TDE Family Law
meta_description: Learn about the importance of establishing paternity and how it affects child support, inheritance rights, and family medical histories.
first_100_words: Paternity Lawyer in Atlanta Under Georgia law, fathers have legal rights and responsibilities with respect to their children. However, in many cases, legal action is necessary to take advantage of the rights and enforce the responsibilities. Paternity establishes a biological connection between a father and child. While paternity may be assumed in some situations, in others, parents need to work with a family law attorney to establish paternity in Atlanta. meta_title: High-Asset Divorce - TDE Family Law
meta_description: Expert legal counsel for high-asset divorces in Georgia. Learn how equitable distribution laws play a crucial role in the complex division of substantial financial investments and valuable assets.
h1: High-Asset Divorce & Georgia’s Equitable Distribution Laws
first_100_words: High-Asset Divorce & Georgia’s Equitable Distribution Laws At TDE Family Law & Divorce Attorneys, we understand the complexities that arise in high-asset divorces. A crucial factor to consider is Georgia’s equitable distribution laws. Unlike community property states, where assets are divided 50/50, Georgia operates under an equitable distribution system, meaning assets are divided “fairly” but not necessarily equally. High-Asset Divorce and Asset Division Divorce is inherently challenging and can be even more complicated when significant assets are involved.
